marketNews.title: Foreign Inflow Continues, IHSG Nearing 8,000
marketNews.content: The IHSG strengthened +1.3% to the level of 7,892.9 today, Wednesday (13/8), along with the continuation of foreign fund inflows amounting to ~1.5 trillion rupiah. This realization marks a net foreign inflow for 3 consecutive days in the IHSG since the beginning of this week, including an inflow of 2.2 trillion rupiah on Tuesday (12/8) which marked the highest daily inflow since May 14, 2025. Since the beginning of 2025, the IHSG still records a net foreign outflow of 57.3 trillion rupiah as of Wednesday (13/8). The entry of foreign funds into the IHSG pushed up the prices of blue chip stocks since the beginning of this week, with BBRI +10.3%, BMRI +4.3%, BBCA +7.5%, BBNI +7.4%, ASII +5.2%, and TLKM +14.3%. This foreign inflow and the rise in blue chip stocks followed the increase in conglomerate group stocks following the MSCI announcement on Friday (8/8), where DSSA and CUAN were included in the MSCI Indonesia Global Standard. The rise in the aforementioned stocks brought the IHSG closer to the 8,000 level, aligning with the optimism of the IDX President Director, Iman Rachman, who said that the IHSG could break through the 8,000 level on the 80th anniversary of the Republic of Indonesia. Positive sentiment came from the global sphere along with strengthening expectations for a Fed interest rate cut - following weak US labor market data releases and US inflation data that were relatively in line with expectations - as well as the extension of the US-China trade negotiation period. As of Wednesday (13/8), the probability of a 25 bps interest rate cut at the September 2025 meeting was at 96.2%, based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool. Until the end of the year, the probability of a minimum 50 bps US interest rate cut stands at 93.7%, slightly increasing compared to last week at 92.7%. Foreign inflow into the Indonesian capital market had already occurred earlier in the government bond market, reflected in the yield of the 10-year government bond declining to the level of 6.406% as of today, having dropped by -0.175 percentage point MTD. The Rupiah exchange rate also strengthened to 16,195 per today, marking a strengthening of +1.8% MTD. Key Takeaway: We assess that the sustainability of the foreign inflow going forward will depend, among other things, on the improvement of Indonesia's economic fundamentals. In the short term, we see that investors will focus on the potential acceleration of government spending in 2H25. Globally, investors need to monitor the developments regarding the impact of US tariff policies which began to be implemented in August 2025, considering their potential influence on inflation and the direction of The Fed's interest rate policy.

marketNews.title: Village Cooperative Merah Putih Defaulting on Payments to Receive Aid of Up to 30% of Village Fund Allocation
marketNews.content: The Minister of Villages and Disadvantaged Regions Development, Yandri Susanto, stated on Wednesday (13/8) that the Merah Putih Village Cooperative, which defaulted on payments, will receive support from village funds up to 30% of the annual village fund ceiling. The village fund ceiling varies in each village, ranging from 400 million rupiah to 1.6 billion rupiah.

marketNews.title: ESDM Sector Investment Realization in 1H25 Reaches US$13.9 Billion, Highest in 5 Years
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) noted that the realization of investment in the energy and mineral resources sector during 1H25 grew +24.1% YoY to US$13.9 billion or approximately 225.5 trillion rupiah, marking the highest realization in the last 5 years. The growth in investment realization was driven by the oil and gas (+28.8% YoY) and mineral/coal (+29.2% YoY) sectors. Based on sector, oil and gas had the largest contribution to investment realization (58%), followed by the mineral/coal sector (22%), electricity (14%), and New and Renewable Energy (EBT) (6%). In terms of state revenue, the non-tax state revenue for ESDM during 1H25 reached 138.8 trillion, equivalent to 54.5% of the 2025 target.

marketNews.title: Government Finalizes Presidential Regulation on Waste-to-Energy Plants, Eliminating Tipping Fee Scheme
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of ESDM, Eniya Listiani Dewi, stated that the presidential regulation regarding the acceleration of waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) development will abolish the tipping fee mechanism, which is a fee paid by local governments to PLTSa operators for every ton of waste processed. This new model will reportedly be based on licensing. Eniya added that Danantara has the potential to handle the selection process for PLTSa project developers, before the licensing is continued at the Ministry of ESDM. Nevertheless, Eniya stated that Danantara's involvement is only for PLTSa with an input of at least 1,000 tons per day.

marketNews.title: China Pledges More Financial Support with Loan Interest Subsidies to Boost Consumption
marketNews.content: China's Vice Minister of Finance, Liao Min, stated on Wednesday (13/8) that the Chinese government plans to offer loan interest subsidies to households and businesses to reduce borrowing costs and spur consumption. This policy differs from previous policies where the Chinese government required banks to offer low-interest loans. Previously, on Tuesday (12/8), the Chinese government announced it would offer interest subsidies of 1 percentage point for business actors in eight consumer service sectors and individual consumers.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Boosts Number of International Airports to Push Travel
marketNews.content: The government on Tuesday (12/8) increased the number of airports with international status from 22 airports to 40 airports to boost tourism and economic growth during the era of President Prabowo Subianto. This move reverses the policy of the Joko Widodo presidency last year, where the government reduced the number of international airports to 17 to control costs. Last year, the government stated that only 5 airports operated international flights routinely, while the rest only served limited routes or not at all.

tickerNews.title: GOTO 1H25: Adjusted EBITDA Rp820 Billion, In Line with Guidance
tickerNews.content: GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia recorded pro-forma adjusted EBITDA of 427 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: positive 393 billion rupiah, 2Q24: negative 64 billion rupiah), based on pro-forma financial performance. This result brought the adjusted EBITDA for 1H25 to 820 billion rupiah (vs. 1H24: negative 165 billion rupiah), in line with management's 2025F guidance targeting a range of 1.4-1.6 trillion rupiah. On the bottom line, the pro-forma net loss recorded was 222 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: loss of 276 billion rupiah, 2Q24: loss of 954 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: AMMN Director Sells 26 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Director, Lal Naveen Chandra, sold 26 million AMMN shares at an average price of 8,828 rupiah per share on August 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~229.5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Lal Naveen Chandra's direct ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.109% to 0.073%.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Shareholder Sold ~2.6 Billion Shares
tickerNews.content: DEWA: Darma Henwa shareholder, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold ~2.6 billion DEWA shares at an average price of 208 rupiah per share on August 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~548.9 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara's direct ownership in DEWA decreased from 19.58% to 13.09%.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Plans to Change Management Structure, Proposes Adding Independent Commissioner Position
tickerNews.content: TLKM: Telkom Indonesia plans to change its management structure, which will be discussed in an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on September 3, 2025. TLKM's SVP Corporate Communication & Investor Relation, Ahmad Reza, told Bloomberg Technoz that the company plans to add an independent commissioner position.

tickerNews.title: EXCL Approves Appointment of Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia as New Director
tickerNews.content: EXCL: XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera shareholders on Tuesday (12/8) approved the appointment of Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia as the company's new director. Sanjay joined XLSmart on July 1, 2025, as Chief Integration Officer. Previously, Sanjay served as Chief Integration Officer at Indosat (ISAT) from 2021-2024.
